data.text: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits,
The good man is perished out of the earth:
That they may do evil with both hands earnestly,
The best of them is as a brier:
Trust ye not in a friend,
For the son dishonoureth the father,
Therefore I will look unto the Lord;
Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy:
I will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him,
Then she that is mine enemy shall see it, and shame shall cover her
In the day that thy walls are to be built,
In that day also he shall come even to thee
Notwithstanding the land shall be desolate because of them that dwell therein,
Feed thy people with thy rod, the flock of thine heritage,
According to the days of thy coming out of the land of Egypt
The nations shall see and be confounded at all their might:
They shall lick the dust like a serpent,
Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity,
He will turn again, he will have compassion upon us;
Thou wilt perform the truth to Jacob, and the mercy to Abraham,
